intro: Siphocampylus macrophyllus, commonly known as the large-leaf siphocampylus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its large, compound leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to Central America and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
